hints.content:
To find how much longer $\purpleD{\text{Hermione's broomstick}}$ is compared to $\blueE{\text{Ginny's broomstick}}$, we need to find the difference.  So, we subtract.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/f49a9dffc0b5b5bbcfb7ae7955920b47c8fc3738)

$\purpleD{61}\text{ inches} - \blueE{56}\text{ inches}  = \maroonD{\square}\text{ inches} $

Let's subtract to find the difference.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/07d8830cbf3e689233ec23e03b3172ced73fa8f5)

$\purpleD{61}\text{ inches}  - \blueE{56}\text{ inches}  = \maroonD{5}\text{ inches} $
Hermione's broomstick is $\maroonD{5} \text{ in}$ longer than Ginny's broomstick.

question.content:
Harry and his wizard friends measured the lengths of their broomsticks.

Friend | Length  
- | - | -
Harry | $59 \text { inches}$ 
Ron | $54 \text { inches}$ 
Hermione |  $61 \text { inches}$ 
Ginny |  $56 \text { inches}$ 

**How much longer is Hermione's broomstick than Ginny's broomstick?**  

[[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]] $\text{inches}$
